partial_orders.reason: Both edits perform an identical structural transformation on similar class definitions in the same codebase. Edit 0 changes ElgatoButtonEntityDescriptionMixin to ElgatoButtonEntityDescription with @dataclass(kw_only=True) and inherits from ButtonEntityDescription. Edit 1 performs the exact same pattern: changes ElgatoEntityDescriptionMixin to ElgatoSwitchEntityDescription with @dataclass(kw_only=True) and inherits from SwitchEntityDescription. This is a bulk refactoring operation applying the same before→after pattern (removing mixin pattern, adding kw_only=True, changing inheritance structure) to the same type of syntactic construct (dataclass entity descriptions) across related files in the same component. Both edits are part of a single, contiguous refactor to standardize entity description classes.

This is a bulk refactoring operation applying the same before→after pattern (removing mixin pattern, adding kw_only=True, changing inheritance structure) to the same type of syntactic construct (dataclass entity descriptions) across related files in the same component. Both edits are part of a single, contiguous refactor to standardize entity description classes.

Edit 0 changes the class definition from 'ElgatoButtonEntityDescriptionMixin' to 'ElgatoButtonEntityDescription', while Edit 1 removes the old 'ElgatoButtonEntityDescription' class that inherited from both 'ButtonEntityDescription' and 'ElgatoButtonEntityDescriptionMixin'. These edits are part of a single refactoring operation where the mixin pattern is being replaced with direct inheritance. The changed lines reference the exact same symbol 'ElgatoButtonEntityDescriptionMixin' - Edit 0 renames it and Edit 1 removes its usage. This creates a direct code dependency where either edit naturally prompts the other as the next mechanical step in the refactoring.

Edit 0 removes the ElgatoEntityDescriptionMixin class and changes ElgatoSensorEntityDescription to inherit only from SensorEntityDescription. Edit 1 adds the value_fn field directly to ElgatoSensorEntityDescription. These edits are part of a single refactoring operation where the mixin is being eliminated and its contents moved directly into the main class. The value_fn field that was previously defined in the mixin (edit 0 removes it) is being added directly to the class (edit 1 adds it). This creates a direct structural dependency - removing the mixin inheritance requires moving its fields to the target class. Either edit can be applied first without causing parse errors, but they form a cohesive refactoring unit where one naturally prompts the other.

Both edits perform an identical structural transformation: removing an ElgatoEntityDescriptionMixin class and modifying the corresponding entity description class to inherit directly from the base description class while adding kw_only=True to the dataclass decorator. The edits represent a synchronized removal of a mixin pattern in favor of direct inheritance, which would naturally be done as part of a single, contiguous refactoring task.
